org.ardenus.state

Class GameState

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ardenus.state.GameState
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    LoadState

    public abstract class GameState
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a state in the game program.
    Author:
    Trent "Whirvis" Summerlin

      • getId

        public abstract int getId()
        Returns:
        the game state ID.

      • init

        public final void init(Game game,
                       java.lang.Object... args)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Initializes the game.
        Parameters:
        game - the game the state belongs to.
        args - arguments for initializing the state.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • getGame

        public Game getGame()
        Returns:
        the game that the state belongs to.

      • onInit

        public void onInit(Game game,
                   java.lang.Object... args)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Called when the state is initialized.
        Parameters:
        game - the game the state belongs to.
        args - the arguments for initializing the state.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • getResources

        public LoadableResource[] getResources(Game game)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        game - the game the state belongs to.
        Returns:
        the resources that need to be loaded. If the code that would normally be in onInit() can not be called without these resources, it is perfectly fine to put said code in the onLoadableResourceFinish() method instead as it is called after onInit() is.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • onLoadableResourceFinish

        public void onLoadableResourceFinish(Game game,
                                     LoadTask task,
                                     java.lang.Object[] resources,
                                     int resourceIndex)
        Parameters:
        task - the load task. This is can be optionally used, however it is good to make use of its setTask() function as it shows what is going on during the finishing up of the class resource loading (such as image storing, input initializing, etc.)
        game - the game the state belongs to.
        resources - the resources that have been loaded.
        resourceIndex - the resource index.

      • onEnterState

        public void onEnterState(Game game,
                         java.lang.Object... args)
        Called when the state has been entered.
        Parameters:
        game - the game the state belongs to.
        args - arguments for entering the state.
